revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=October 2015}} {{Infobox film | name = Goosebumps | image = Goosebumps (film) poster.jpg | alt = | caption = Theatrical release poster | director = [[Rob Letterman]] | producer = {{Plainlist| * [[Deborah Forte]] * [[Neal H. Moritz]] }} | screenplay = [[Darren Lemke]] | story = [[Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski|Scott Alexander
Larry Karaszewski]] | based on = {{based on|''[[Goosebumps]]''|[[R. L. Stine]]}} | starring = {{plainlist| * [[Jack Black]] * [[Dylan Minnette]] * [[Odeya Rush]] * [[Amy Ryan]] * [[Ryan Lee (actor)|Ryan Lee]] * [[Jillian Bell]] }} | music = [[Danny Elfman]] | cinematography = [[Javier Aguirresarobe]] | editing = Jim May | production companies = {{Plainlist| * [[Sony Pictures Animation]]{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/goosebumps-film-review-829281|title='Goosebumps': Film Review|last=Rechtshaffen|first=Michael|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=October 5, 2015|accessdate=May 19, 2018}} * [[LStar Capital]] * [[Village Roadshow Pictures]] * [[Original Film]] * [[Scholastic Corporation|Scholastic Entertainment]] }} | distributor = [[Columbia Pictures]] | released = {{Film date|2015|6|24|[[CineEurope]]|2015|10|16|United States|ref1=}} | runtime = 103 minutes{{cite web | url=http://www.bbfc.co.uk/releases/goosebumps-film | title=''GOOSEBUMPS'' [2D] (PG) | work=[[British Board of Film Classification]] | date=September 28, 2015 | accessdate=September 28, 2015}} | country = United States | language = English | budget = $58–84 million{{Cite news|url=https://www.filmla.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/2015_film_study_v5_WEB.pdf|title=2015 Feature Film Study|last=FilmL.A.|first=|date=June 15, 2016|work=|access-date=June 16, 2016|via=}} | gross = $150.2 million{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=goosebumps.htm |title=Goosebumps (2015) |website=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=June 16, 2016}} }} '''''Goosebumps''''' is a 2015 American [[comedy horror|horror comedy]] film directed by [[Rob Letterman]] and written by [[Darren Lemke]] from a story by [[Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski]]. The film is based on the [[Goosebumps|children's horror book series of the same name]] by [[R. L. Stine]] and stars [[Jack Black]], [[Dylan Minnette]], [[Odeya Rush]], [[Amy Ryan]], [[Ryan Lee (actor)|Ryan Lee]], and [[Jillian Bell]]. The plot follows a teenager trying to save his town with R. L. Stine's help after all monsters, demons and creatures from the ''Goosebumps'' franchise begin to escape from their books, wreaking havoc in the real world. It was financed by Sony, [[LStar Capital]], and [[Village Roadshow Pictures]],{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-preview-goosebumps-could-831790|title=Box-Office Preview: 'Goosebumps' Could Out-Spook 'Crimson Peak,' 'Bridge of Spies'|author=Pamela McClintock|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|publisher=([[Prometheus Global Media]])|date=October 13, 2015|accessdate=October 14, 2015}} and also produced by [[Sony Pictures Animation]], [[Original Film]], and [[Scholastic Corporation|Scholastic Entertainment]]. ''Goosebumps'' was released on October 16, 2015, in the United States by [[Columbia Pictures]] in [[RealD 3D]] and [[4DX]].{{cite news|last1=Berkshire|first1=Geoff|title=Film Review: 'Goosebumps'|url=https://variety.com/2015/film/reviews/goosebumps-film-review-r-l-stine-1201608681/|accessdate=October 14, 2015|work=Variety|date=October 5, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.cj4dx.com/movie4dx/movie4dx.php|title=Official list of 4DX motion-enhanced films|work=[[4DX]]|accessdate=September 25, 2018}} and received generally positive reviews from critics. It grossed $150 million against its $84 million budget. A sequel titled ''[[Goosebumps 2: Haunted Halloween]]'' was released on October 12, 2018. ==Plot== After his father's recent death, Zach Cooper ([[Dylan Minnette]]) and his mother Gale ([[Amy Ryan]]) move from [[New York City]] to the peaceful town of Madison, [[Delaware]]. While settling in the new neighborhood, Zach befriends his neighbor Hannah ([[Odeya Rush]]) until her overprotective father ([[Jack Black]]) warns him to avoid contact with them. The next morning, at Madison High School, where Gale works as vice-principal, Zach befriends Champ ([[Ryan Lee (actor)|Ryan Lee]]), a shy and clumsy student. That night, Hannah invites Zach to an abandoned [[amusement park]] but when they return home, Hannah's father warns again that Zach stays away or something bad will happen. The following night, Zach listens as Hannah and her father argue. Followed by screams and crashings objects, he calls the police. Hannah's father assures officers that the noises comes from his television. Shortly after, Gale leaves to supervise a [[spring break]] dance at school, leaving Zach with his aunt Lorraine ([[Jillian Bell]]). Fearing that Hannah is in danger, Zach tricks her father into going to the police station while he enters his home with Champ's help. While investigating, they both find a bookshelf with numerous books from the [[Goosebumps|''Goosebumps'' franchise]], each mysteriously locked. In response to Champ's curiosity, Zach opens ''[[The Abominable Snowman of Pasadena]]'', releasing the real [[Yeti|Abominable Snowman]]. With Hannah's help, they chase the monster to a local [[ice rink]] where Hannah's father appears and encloses the creature again in the book. Back home, Hannah's father unwittingly reveals that he is ''Goosebumps''' author, [[R. L. Stine]]. When they arrive, the group meets [[Slappy the Dummy]], the evil [[Ventriloquism|ventriloquist dummy]] from ''[[Goosebumps (original series)|Night of the Living Dummy]]''. As revenge for being locked up for years, Slappy burns his own book and flees with all the other ''Goosebumps'' books in the Haunted Car from [[The Haunted Car|the book of the same name]], after having released him. Stine and the kids are attacked by living [[Garden gnome|lawn gnomes]] from ''[[Revenge of the Lawn Gnomes]]'', being forced to escape. Meanwhile, Slappy rampages through Madison, releasing several monsters, causing panic and destruction around the town: [[mutant]] [[plant]]s from ''[[Stay Out of the Basement]]'' destroy the cell towers; a [[vampire]] [[poodle]] from ''[[Please Don't Feed the Vampire!]]'' attacks Lorraine; and the Body Squeezers from ''[[Invasion of the Body Squeezers]]'' freeze the officers at the police station. Zach implores Stine to write a new book that can lock all the monsters back, but it can only be done with a supernatural [[typewriter]] displayed at school. Along the way, the group is attacked by Brent Green from ''[[My Best Friend Is Invisible|My Best Friend is Invisible]]'' and the giant [[Mantis|praying mantis]] from ''[[A Shocker on Shock Street]]'', so they hide in a supermarket. Will Blake, the [[werewolf]] from ''[[The Werewolf of Fever Swamp]]'' chases them to the parking lot where he is run over by Lorraine, who survived the attack. However, she is frozen by the Body Squeezers when she enters the police station to ask for help. Stine and the kids go through a [[cemetery]], where Zach realizes that Hannah shines in the moonlight before being attacked by [[ghoul]]s from ''[[Attack of the Graveyard Ghouls]]''. When they arrive at school, Zach confronts Stine in private; he reveals that his daughter is Hannah Fairchild from ''[[The Ghost Next Door]]'', creating her to face his loneliness, although she isn't aware that she isn't real. Stine finds the typewriter and begins writing a book based on the events of the film while Slappy burns all the books, releasing every monster, demon and creature spotted in the ''Goosebumps'' franchise on the school's soccer field. Zach and Champ try to warn the students, but nobody believes them until the monsters begin to break into the building. Bees from ''[[Why I'm Afraid of Bees]]'' attack Zach in the library while the rest of the monsters manage to enter the school with the help of the Annihilator 3000 from ''[[Toy Terror: Batteries Included]]''. Champ saves Taylor from the werewolf and become love interests. Slappy finds Stine and breaks his fingers with the typewriter before he can finish the book. While the students and school staff continue to defend themselves from the monsters' attack, Stine and the kids board a school bus to the abandoned amusement park. Slappy discovers them and releases the Blob from ''[[The Blob That Ate Everyone]]'' as the monsters arrive at the park. Stine confronts the creature and is devoured while Zach, Hannah and Champ climb a [[Ferris wheel]] to finish the book. However, the monsters collapse the Ferris wheel, causing it to roll towards the forest. Zach refuses to open the book because Hannah will also be locked up, but she reveals that she knew the truth about herself all this time. Hannah opens the book, sucking Slappy and all the ''Goosebumps'' monsters inside, saying goodbye to Zach with a kiss before being sucked in. Some time later, Stine starts working as the new English teacher at the school while starting to date Lorraine. After school, Stine reveals to Zach that he re-wrote Hannah back into reality with a new book. She and Zach kiss and leave school together while Stine burns Hannah's book, making her permanently real. When Stine is about to leave school, he looks at the typewriter writing by itself. To his horror, Brent Green has escaped his imprisonment, beginning to write a new ''Goosebumps'' book entitled ''The Invisible Boy's Revenge''. ==Cast== {{multiple image | direction = horizontal | image1 = Goosebumps,_Jack_Black,_SDCC_2014_07.jpg | width1 = 100 | image2 = OdeyaRush2011-1-.jpg | width2 = 100 | image3 = Dylan_Minnette_2010.jpg | width3 = 107 | footer = [[Jack Black]], [[Dylan Minnette]], and [[Odeya Rush]] starred in the film as [[R. L. Stine|Mr. Stine]], Zach, and Hannah. }} * [[Jack Black]] as [[R. L. Stine]], a single father with a secret past,{{cite news|title=Goosebumps Feature Film, Starring Jack Black, Starts Principal Photography|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=117452|accessdate=April 24, 2014|publisher=ComingSoon.net|date=April 23, 2014}} who Hannah lives with. ** Black also voices [[Slappy the Dummy]] (a living ventriloquist dummy from the ''Night of the Living Dummy'' books,{{cite web | url=http://collider.com/rob-letterman-goosebumps-interview-comic-con/ | title=Comic-Con: Director Rob Letterman Talks GOOSEBUMPS, Casting Jack Black as R.L. Stine, Choosing which Monsters to Include, and More | publisher=Collider | accessdate=November 8, 2014 | last=Foutch | first=Haleigh}} who Avery Lee Jones provided the puppeteer work for) and Brent Green (the invisible boy from ''My Best Friend is Invisible''). ** The real R. L. Stine appears as, ironically, Mr. Black, the new drama teacher at Madison High School that Black's Stine encounters in the hallway. He was credited as "Hallway Player".{{cite web |last=Stine |first=R. L. |title=.@mdroush Jack Black plays me in the GB movie, now filming in GA. I'm going down to do a cameo next month. |publisher=Twitter |date=May 20, 2014 |url=https://twitter.com/RL_Stine/status/468907719236530178 |accessdate=May 24, 2014}} * [[Dylan Minnette]] as Zachary "Zach" Cooper,{{cite web|last=Kroll|first=Justin|url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/dylan-minnette-to-co-star-with-jack-black-in-goosebumps-1201104676/ |title=Dylan Minnette to Co-Star With Jack Black in 'Goosebumps' |work=Variety |date=February 14, 2014 |accessdate=April 24, 2014}} R. L. Stine's new neighbor. * [[Odeya Rush]] as Hannah Stine,{{cite web|last=Sneider|first=Jeff|url=http://www.thewrap.com/giver-actress-odeya-rush-join-jack-black-sonys-goosebumps-movie-exclusive/ |title='The Giver' Actress Odeya Rush to Join Jack Black in Sony's 'Goosebumps' Movie (Exclusive) |publisher=TheWrap |date=February 13, 2014 |accessdate=April 24, 2014}} Stine's adopted daughter, Zach's new neighbor and love interest, secretly Hannah Fairchild from ''The Ghost Next Door''.{{cite web|last=Cruz|first=Lisa|title=The Scariest Thing About the Goosebumps Movie|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/entertainment/archive/2015/10/the-scariest-part-about-goosebumps/411349/|website=The Atlantic|accessdate=January 21, 2016|date=October 21, 2015}} * [[Amy Ryan]] as Gale Cooper, Zach's mother who becomes the vice-principal at Madison High School.{{cite web|last=Sneider|first=Jeff|url=http://www.thewrap.com/amy-ryan-workaholics-star-jillian-bell-join-jack-black-goosebumps-exclusive/ |title=Amy Ryan, 'Workaholics' Star Jillian Bell Join Jack Black in 'Goosebumps' (Exclusive) |publisher=TheWrap |date=April 4, 2014 |accessdate=April 24, 2014}} * [[Ryan Lee (actor)|Ryan Lee]] as Champ, Zach's new friend.{{cite web|last=Kroll|first=Justin|url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/super-8-actor-joins-sonys-goosebumps-1201161462/ |title='Super 8′ Actor Joins Sony's 'Goosebumps' |work=Variety |date=April 23, 2014 |accessdate=April 24, 2014}} * [[Jillian Bell]] as Lorraine Conyers, Zach's aunt and Gale's sister. * [[Halston Sage]] as Taylor, a popular student at Madison High School whom Champ has a crush on and will become his love interest.{{cite web|last=Ford|first=Rebecca|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/sonys-goosebumps-adds-neighbors-actress-699368 |title=Sony's 'Goosebumps' Adds 'Neighbors' Actress (Exclusive) |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=April 28, 2014 |accessdate=April 29, 2014}} * [[Ken Marino]] as Coach Carr, the gym teacher at Madison High School who hits on Gale.{{cite web|last=Yamato |first=Jen |url=http://www.deadline.com/2014/04/ken-marino-goosebumps-movie/ |title=Ken Marino Cast In Sony's 'Goosebumps' |website=Deadline Hollywood |date=April 10, 2014 |accessdate=April 24, 2014}} * [[Timothy Simons]] as Officer Stevens, a police officer that works for the Madison Police Department.{{cite web|last=Sneider |first=Jeff |url=http://www.thewrap.com/veep-star-timothy-simons-joins-goosebumps-joe-swanbergs-digging-fire-exclusive/ |title='Veep' Star Timothy Simons Joins 'Goosebumps,' Joe Swanberg's 'Digging for Fire' (Exclusive) |publisher=TheWrap |date=April 30, 2014 |accessdate=May 2, 2014}} * Amanda Lund as Officer Brooks, a police officer trainee that works for the Madison Police Department and is partnered with Officer Stevens. * [[Steven Krueger]] as Davidson, a popular student at Madison High School.{{cite web|last=Halterman |first=Jim |url=http://www.thebacklot.com/the-originals-steven-krueger-interview/04/2014/ |title=TheBacklot Interview: Steven Krueger |publisher=The Backlot |date=April 15, 2014 |accessdate=April 24, 2014}} * Keith Arthur Bolden as Principal Garrison, the principal of Madison High School. * [[Karan Soni]] as Mr. Rooney * [[Kumail Nanjiani]] as Foreman ==Production== ===Development=== The first attempt at a ''Goosebumps'' film, in 1998, was set to be produced by [[Tim Burton]]. [[Chris Meledandri]], the president of Fox Family Films at the time, said, "I think you'll see us tackling a scale of story that would be prohibitive to do on the small screen".{{cite web |last=Flamm |first=Matthew |url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,281459,00.html |title=Between The Lines |date=January 9, 1998 |website=[[Entertainment Weekly]] |accessdate=August 17, 2013}} However, the film did not materialize since they could not find a script they liked or determine which book or monster to adapt.{{cite web | url=https://www.thewrap.com/goosebumps-rl-stine-tim-burton-stephen-king/ | title='Goosebumps' Author R.L. Stine on Movie Cameo, Stephen King and What Scares Him | publisher=The Wrap | date=October 13, 2015 | accessdate=October 29, 2015 | last=Sneider | first=Jeff}} In 2008, [[Columbia Pictures]] acquired rights to create a ''Goosebumps'' film.{{Cite news |last=Barr |first=Jason |title=Carl Ellsworth to Write Feature Adaptation of R.L. Stine's Goosebumps |publisher=Collider.com |url=http://collider.com/carl-ellsworth-goosebumps-r-l-stine/ |accessdate=August 30, 2013 }} [[Neal H. Moritz|Neal Moritz]] and [[Deborah Forte]], the latter of whom had previously worked on the ''[[Goosebumps (TV series)|Goosebumps]]'' television series in the 1990s, were chosen to produce the film.{{cite web | url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/45026-columbia-pictures-acquires-goosebumps-rights | title=Columbia Pictures Acquires Goosebumps Rights | publisher=ComingSoon.net | date=May 15, 2008 | accessdate=December 29, 2014 | author=CS}} Screenwriting team [[Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski]] were hired as screenwriters,{{cite web | url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2008/11/17/goosebumps-the-movie | title=GOOSEBUMPS: THE MOVIE | publisher=IGN | date=November 17, 2008 | accessdate=December 29, 2014 | author=Vejvoda, Jim}} and wrote the original script for the film. The duo decided against adapting any one book in the series, feeling the individual books in the series were too short. Thinking of ways to create a universe where all the creatures in the books could live together, they elected to do a fake [[biographical film]] where R. L. Stine writes a book and the monsters within it become real.{{cite web | url=http://www.latinpost.com/articles/28337/20141226/exclusive-interview-scott-alexander-larry-karaszewski-tim-burtons-latest-big.htm | title=Big Eyes Movie News, Cast & Release Date: Scott Alexander, Larry Karaszewski Discuss Tim Burton's Latest Work (Exclusive) | publisher=Latin Post | date=December 26, 2014 | accessdate=December 29, 2014 | author=Salazar, Francisco | author2=Salazar, David}} In 2010, [[Carl Ellsworth]] was chosen to write the screenplay.{{cite news |title=Writer Carl Ellsworth Gets ''Goosebumps'' |publisher=ComingSoon.net |date=September 16, 2010 |url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=69876 |accessdate=October 27, 2010 }} On January 14, 2012, it was reported that a new draft of the screenplay would be written by Darren Lemke; Lemke co-wrote the screenplays for ''[[Shrek Forever After]]'' and [[Bryan Singer]]'s ''[[Jack the Giant Slayer]]''.{{cite news |last=Puchko |first=Kristy |url=http://www.cinemablend.com/new/Jack-Giant-Killer-Scribe-Give-Goosebumps-Movie-Fresh-Start-28858.html |title=Will Jack the Giant Killer Scribe Give The Goosebumps Movie A Fresh Start? |date=January 13, 2012 |publisher=Cinema Blend |accessdate=August 17, 2013 }} In November 2012, Stine expressed pessimism about the prospect of the film, saying that he would believe that a film can be based on his ''Goosebumps'' series when he sees it. He mentioned ''[[Where the Wild Things Are]]'' being adapted into a film almost 50 years after publication.{{cite web |last=Puchko |first=Kristy |url=http://www.cinemablend.com/new/R-L-Stine-Optimistic-About-Goosebumps-Movie-Coming-Soon-34106.html |title=R.L. Stine Not Optimistic About Goosebumps Movie Coming Soon |date=November 14, 2012 |publisher=Cinema Blend |accessdate=August 17, 2013 }} ===Casting=== [[File:Goosebumps, Jack Black, Monsters, SDCC 2014.jpg|thumb|[[Jack Black]] "fighting" Slappy and his fellow monsters at the 2014 [[San Diego Comic-Con International]].]] [[File:Goosebumps, Jack Black, Rob Letterman, SDCC 2014-2.jpg|thumb|The film marks the third collaboration between Jack Black and director [[Rob Letterman]], who previously worked together on ''[[Shark Tale]]'' and ''[[Gulliver's Travels (2010 film)|Gulliver's Travels]]'']] In September 2013, it was reported that [[Jack Black]] was in talks to "play a Stine-like author whose scary characters literally leap off the page, forcing him to hide from his own creepy creations".{{cite news|last=Sneider|first=Jeff|title=Jack Black in Negotiations to Star in 'Goosebumps' Movie for Sony, Scholastic Media (Exclusive)|url=http://www.thewrap.com/jack-black-in-negotiations-to-star-in-goosebumps-movie-for-sony-scholastic-media-exclusive/|accessdate=September 14, 2013|newspaper=The Wrap|date=September 13, 2013}} Black stated that he tried to make the character "more of a sort of curmudgeonly dark, brooding beast master". He also said that he attempted to approach this film the same way he does others, trying to "make it as funny as possible".{{cite web|last=Terrero|first=Nina|title=Jack Black talks 'Goosebumps' movie|url=http://insidemovies.ew.com/2014/07/17/jack-black-goosebumps-movie/|accessdate=July 19, 2014|website=Entertainment Weekly|date=July 17, 2014}} Black met with R. L. Stine to get his consent for the film, but determined that his character could not be too similar to the real one; Black explained that he needed the character to be more sinister.{{cite news | url=http://spinoff.comicbookresources.com/2014/07/27/sdcc-sony-pictures-raises-goosebumps-displays-pixels/ | title=SDCC | Sony Pictures Raises 'Goosebumps,' Displays 'Pixels' | date=July 27, 2014 | accessdate=August 2, 2014 | last=Manning |first=Shaun |publisher=Comic Book Resources}} [[Rob Letterman]] was chosen as the director, reuniting him with Black, after working together on ''[[Shark Tale]]'' and ''[[Gulliver's Travels (2010 film)|Gulliver's Travels]]''. It was announced in February 2014 that [[Dylan Minnette]] had been cast as Zach Cooper,{{cite news |last=Fleming Jr. |first=Mike |title=Dylan Minnette To Star Opposite Jack Black In Sony's 'Goosebumps' |website=Deadline Hollywood |date=February 14, 2014 |url=http://www.deadline.com/2014/02/dylan-minnette-goosebumps-movie-casting-jack-black/ |accessdate=March 13, 2014 }} and [[Odeya Rush]] as Stine-like author's daughter, Hannah. On February 26, 2014, it was announced that the film would be released on March 23, 2016.{{cite news |title=Columbia Pictures Sets Release Date for the Goosebumps Movie |publisher=ComingSoon.net |date=February 26, 2014 |url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=115361/ |accessdate=February 26, 2014 }}{{cite news |last=Kroll |first=Justin |title=Dylan Minnette to Co-Star With Jack Black in 'Goosebumps' |work=Variety |date=February 14, 2014 |url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/dylan-minnette-to-co-star-with-jack-black-in-goosebumps-1201104676/ |accessdate=March 13, 2014 }} On April 4, 2014, it was announced that [[Amy Ryan]] and [[Jillian Bell]] had joined the cast as Cooper's mother and aunt respectively. On April 10, 2014, [[Ken Marino]] joined the cast as Coach Carr. On April 28, 2014, [[Halston Sage]] joined the cast. On May 1, 2014, the film's release date was moved up to August 7, 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.deadline.com/2014/05/goosebumps-release-date-smurfs-reboot-august-2016/ |title=A Sony Switcheroo: 'Smurfs' Reboot Pushed To 2016, 'Goosebumps' Moved Up To Summer 2015 |website=Deadline Hollywood |date=May 1, 2014 |accessdate=May 1, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140503014729/http://www.deadline.com/2014/05/goosebumps-release-date-smurfs-reboot-august-2016/ |archivedate=May 3, 2014 |df=mdy-all }} Stine stated on May 20, 2014, that he was going to make a [[cameo appearance]] in the film. The film was promoted at the 2014 [[San Diego Comic-Con International]] where Jack Black and Rob Letterstein interacted with Slappy the Dummy. Slappy even brought some of his "friends" out consisting of the Bog Monster from ''How to Kill a Monster'', two Graveyard Ghouls from ''Attack of the Graveyard Ghouls'', Cronby the Troll and a Mulgani from ''Deep in the Jungle of Doom'', the Lord High Executioner from ''A Night in Terror Tower'', Murder the Clown from ''A Nightmare on Clown Street'', the Mummy of Prince Khor-Ru from ''Return of the Mummy'', Captain Long Ben One-Leg from ''Creep from the Deep'', Professor Shock from ''The Creepy Creations of Professor Shock'', Count Nightwing from ''Vampire Breath'', a Creep from ''Calling All Creeps!'', a Body Squeezer from ''Invasion of the Body Squeezers: Part 1'' and ''Part 2'', Carly Beth Caldwell's Haunted Mask form from ''The Haunted Mask'', a Scarecrow from ''The Scarecrow Walks at Midnight'', and a Pumpkin Head from ''Attack of the Jack-O'-Lanterns''. When Jack Black tells Slappy that it is him that Slappy wants, Slappy instructs the Lord High Executioner, Murder the Clown, and Professor Shock to take Jack Black outside to his car. As the monsters leave, Slappy tells Rob some of his pitches causing Rob to leave as well.{{cite web|url=https://comiccon2016.sched.org/event/7hKk/goosebumps|title=Comic-Con 2016: Goosebumps|website=Sched.org|access-date=February 7, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FrEdGjXHqN4|title=Jack Black Goosebumps Panel SDCC 2014|first=|last=thejellybat|date=July 30, 2014|publisher=|access-date=February 7, 2018|via=YouTube}} Some monsters due for an appearance in the film were cut for budgetary reasons, but Letterman stated that the crew tried to choose the monsters most appropriate to the story. Letterman also stated that he tried to combine both humor and horror in the film, commenting that "[t]he books themselves are legitimately scary, but they're legitimately funny, and we try to capture that". In November 2014, the release date was moved back to April 15, 2016.{{cite web | url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movie/goosebumps-2016 | title=Goosebumps | publisher=ComingSoon.net | access-date=November 29, 2014}} In January 2015, the release date was pushed forward to October 16, 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/schedule/?view=changes&p=.htm|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150129152044/http://www.boxofficemojo.com/schedule/?view=changes&p=.htm|title=Theatrical Movie Schedule Additions and Changes|archivedate=January 29, 2015|work=archive.org|access-date=January 29, 2015}}{{cite web | url=https://www.facebook.com/GoosebumpsMovie | title=Goosebumps Movie | publisher=Facebook | accessdate=November 29, 2014 | at=Profile picture}} ===Filming=== In mid-April 2014, a crew of six spent three days gathering visual data for the film in downtown [[Madison, Georgia|Madison]], [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]]. The crew used a [[theodolite]] to collect points in three-dimensional space to complete a detailed survey of the city. The visual data was used to create a [[computer-generated imagery|CGI]] background of the downtown.{{cite news|last=Lynn Lecorchick|first=Tia|title=Goosebumps crew creates digital map of Madison|url=http://www.morgancountycitizen.com/goosebumps-crew-creates-digital-map-of-madison/|accessdate=May 24, 2014|work=Morgan County Citizen|date=April 18, 2014}} Neal Moritz and Rob Letterman stated that Madison was their first choice for the film after scouting the city.{{cite news|last=Yost|first=Dianne|title=Madison plays leading role in movie|url=http://www.morgancountycitizen.com/madison-plays-leading-role-in-movie/|accessdate=May 24, 2014|work=Morgan County Citizen|date=May 22, 2014}} [[Principal photography]] on the film began on April 23, 2014 in [[Candler Park]] in [[Atlanta]];{{cite news|last=Brett|first=Jennifer|title='Mockingjay' wraps, 'Goosebumps' underway|url=http://www.accessatlanta.com/news/entertainment/celebrity-news/mockingjay-wraps-up-as-goosebumps-walk-in-the-wood/nfgKp/|accessdate=April 24, 2014|publisher=accessatlanta.com|date=April 23, 2014}} they were also set to shoot the film in [[Conyers, Georgia|Conyers]] and Madison. On May 19, filming was taking place in the streets of Madison,{{cite news|last=Christine|title=Jack Black filming 'Goosebumps' in downtown Madison, GA this week|url=http://www.onlocationvacations.com/2014/05/19/jack-black-fiming-goosebumps-in-downtown-madison-ga-this-week/|accessdate=May 20, 2014|publisher=onlocationvacations.com|date=May 19, 2014}} with 480 ''Goosebumps'' crew members working in Madison and [[Morgan County, Georgia|Morgan County]]. Principal photography ended on July 16, 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.studiosystemnews.com/on-the-set-for-72114-meg-ryan-directs-stars-in-ithaca-adaptation-starting-for-playtone-twcs-tulip-fever-wraps/ |title=On The Set For 7/21/14: Meg Ryan Directs & Stars In 'Ithaca' Adaptation Starting For Playtone, TWC's 'Tulip Fever' Wraps |publisher=Studiosystemnews.com |date=July 21, 2014 |accessdate=August 2, 2014}} A stretch of Dawsonville Highway in Georgia was intermittently closed to film a car travelling up and down multiple bridges for the film.{{cite news | last=Rogers | first=Scott | url=http://www.gainesvilletimes.com/section/6/article/102738/ | title=A ride that gives 'Goosebumps' during movie filming | publisher=gainesvilletimes.com | date=August 1, 2014 | accessdate=August 2, 2014}} ==Music and soundtrack== {{Infobox album | name = Goosebumps (Original Motion Picture Soundtrack) | type = soundtrack | longtype = / [[Film score]] | artist = [[Danny Elfman]] | cover = | alt = | released = October 9, 2015 | recorded = 2015 | venue = | studio = | genre = [[Soundtrack album|Soundtrack]], [[orchestra]]l | length = 64:07 | label = [[Sony Classical Records]] | producer = [[Danny Elfman]] | chronology = [[Danny Elfman]] film scores | prev_title = [[Avengers: Age of Ultron]] | prev_year = 2015 | next_title = [[Alice Through the Looking Glass (2016 film)|Alice Through the Looking Glass]] | next_year = 2016 | misc = {{Singles | name = Goosebumps (Original Motion Picture Soundtrack) | type = soundtrack | single1 = Racketeer | single1date = 2015 | single2 = Everybody Have Fun Tonight | single2date = 2015 | single3 = Better Than the Rest | single3date = 2015 }} }} The soundtrack for the film, featuring original music composed by [[Danny Elfman]], was released on CD on October 23, 2015, by [[Sony Classical Records]]. The digital version was released by [[Madison Gate Records]] the week before.{{cite web|title='Goosebumps' Soundtrack Details|url=http://filmmusicreporter.com/2015/09/17/goosebumps-soundtrack-details/|publisher=Film Music Reporter|accessdate=October 11, 2015}} ;Songs featured in the film *"Racketeer" by [[The Blue Van]] *"Headlights" by OPIEN *"[[Get Ugly]]" by [[Jason Derulo]] *"Everybody Have Fun Tonight" by Ryan Perez-Daple *"Better Than the Rest" by Shock Diamonds *"[[Heads Will Roll (song)|Heads Will Roll]]" ([[A-Trak]] Remix) by [[Yeah Yeah Yeahs]] *"Bumps Gonna Goose Ya" by MF Bumps feat. [[Jack Black]] ==Release== ===Premiere=== ''Goosebumps'' had its world premiere screening on June 24, 2015, at the [[CineEurope]] film distributors' trade fair in [[Barcelona]], Spain, where the film was presented by Black on stage.{{cite journal |last=Ritman |first=Alex |title=CineEurope: Sony Unveils New 'Spectre' Footage, Joseph Gordon-Levitt Walks 'The Walk' |journal=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=June 24, 2015 |accessdate=June 29, 2015 |URL=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/cineeurope-sony-unveils-new-spectre-805006 }} ===Home media=== ''Goosebumps'' was released on [[Blu-ray Disc|Blu-ray]] (2D and 3D) and [[DVD]] on January 26, 2016, and includes deleted scenes, a blooper reel, interviews with the cast and crew, an alternate opening, an alternate ending, and a featurette about Slappy.{{cite web|url=http://www.blu-ray.com/movies/Goosebumps-Blu-ray/142736/ |title=Goosebumps Blu-ray |publisher=Blu-ray.com |date= |accessdate=2016-02-27}} ==Reception== ===Box office=== ''Goosebumps'' grossed $80.1 million in North America and $70.1 million in other territories for a worldwide total of $150.2 million, against a budget of $58 million. In the United States and Canada, pre-release trackings indicated the film would open to between $20–31 million at 3,501 theaters. However, Sony was more conservative, and projected the film to take between $12–15 million.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/10/goosebumps-crimson-peak-bridge-of-spies-steven-spielberg-the-martian-box-office-1201581325/|title='Goosebumps' Set To Freak Out, But 'The Martian' Could Scare It Away – Box Office Preview|author=Anthony D'Alessandro|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=October 14, 2015|accessdate=October 15, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=4113|title=Forecast: 'Goosebumps', 'Spies' & 'Crimson Peak' Jostle for Audience Attention|author=Brad Brevet|work=[[Box Office Mojo]]|date=October 15, 2015|accessdate=October 16, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-crimson-peak-creeps-832523|title=Box Office: 'Crimson Peak' Creeps to $855K, 'Goosebumps' Raises $600K Thursday Night|author=Rebecca Ford|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=October 16, 2015|accessdate=October 16, 2015}} The film opened on October 16, 2015 alongside ''[[Bridge of Spies (film)|Bridge of Spies]]'', ''[[Crimson Peak]]'', and ''[[Woodlawn (film)|Woodlawn]]'', however box office pundits noted that it did not face serious competition except for ''[[The Martian (film)|The Martian]]'', which was entering its third week. It made $600,000 from its early Thursday night screenings at 2,567 theaters, and $7.4 million on its opening day.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/10/goosebumps-bridge-of-spies-crimson-peak-weekend-box-office-1201585023/|title='Crimson Peak', 'Goosebumps' Raise Hairs On Thursday Night – Box Office|author=Anthony D'Alessandro|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=October 16, 2015|accessdate=October 16, 2015}}{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/scottmendelson/2015/10/17/friday-box-office-goosebumps-tops-with-scary-good-7-4m-crimson-peak-nabs-scary-bad-5-2m/|title=Friday Box Office: 'Goosebumps' Tops With Scary Good $7.4M, 'Crimson Peak' Nabs Scary Bad $5.2M|author=Scott Mendelson|work=[[Forbes]]|date=October 17, 2015|accessdate=October 18, 2015}} In its opening weekend the film grossed $23.5 million, beating studio projections and finishing first at the box office. It marked the fourth Sony film to reign at the top of the box office during the fall. Previously the studio scored No. 1 spots over the last seven weeks with ''[[War Room (film)|War Room]]'', ''[[The Perfect Guy (2015 film)|The Perfect Guy]]'' and ''[[Hotel Transylvania 2]]''.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/10/goosebumps-bridge-of-spies-crimson-peak-weekend-box-office-1201585023/|title='Goosebumps' Raises Hair With $23.5M, 'Bridge Of Spies' Eyes $15.4M; 'Crimson Peak' Ekes Out $12.8M – Sunday Postmortem|author=Anthony D'Alessandro|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=October 18, 2015|accessdate=October 19, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=4114&p=.htm|title='Goosebumps' On Top, 'Peak' Flops and A24's 'Room' Strong in Limited Showing|author=Brad Brevet|work=[[Box Office Mojo]]|date=October 18, 2015|accessdate=October 19, 2015}} Families represented the largest demographics with 60%, followed by under 25 with 59% and male/female ratio was split evenly at 50/50. Outside North America, ''Goosebumps'' was released in a total of 66 countries.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/10/crimson-peak-ant-man-martian-hotel-transylvania-scorch-trials-pan-international-box-office-results-1201586990/|title='Ant-Man' Supersizes With $43.2M China Bow; 'Crimson Peak' Reaps $13.4M – International Box Office|author=Nancy Tartaglione|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=October 18, 2015|accessdate=October 19, 2015}} Mexico has so far represented its largest opening as well as the biggest market in terms of total earnings with $7.1 million followed by Australia ($6.3 million) and the United Kingdom and Ireland ($6 million). It opened at No. 1 in the United Kingdom and Ireland ($3.9 million). In the United Kingdom, preview takings helped ''Goosebumps'' top the box office ahead of the more heavily hyped ''[[Dad's Army (2016 film)|Dad's Army]]''.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2016/02/revenant-kung-fu-panda-star-wars-force-awakens-martian-international-box-office-weekend-results-1201697966/|title='Revenant', 'Martian' Land New Global Milestones; 'Kung Fu Panda 3' Tops $100M In China – Intl Box Office|author=Nancy Tartaglione|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=February 7, 2016|access-date=February 8, 2016}} In Russia, it opened at No. 2 behind ''[[In the Heart of the Sea (film)|In the Heart of the Sea]]'' with $1.27 million.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/12/mockingjay-part-2-spectre-the-martian-point-break-good-dinosaur-heart-sea-krampus-international-box-office-results-1201655479/|title=Holdovers Top Chart; 'Heart Of The Sea', 'Point Break' See Small Swells – Intl B.O. Final|author=Nancy Tartaglione|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=December 8, 2015|accessdate=December 9, 2015}} Furthermore, it opened in France with $1 million.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2016/02/deadpool-zoolander-2-how-to-be-single-opening-international-box-office-1201702508/|title='Deadpool' Rises To $125M+, 'Zoolander 2,' 'How To Be Single' Follow – Int'l Box Office|author=Anita Busch|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=February 14, 2016|access-date=February 15, 2016}} ===Critical reception=== On [[Rotten Tomatoes]] the film has an approval rating of 77% based on 152 reviews, with an average rating of 6.3/10. The site's critical consensus reads, "''Goosebumps'' boasts more than enough of its spooky source material's kid-friendly charm to make up for some slightly scattershot humor and a hurried pace."{{cite web | url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/goosebumps_2015/ | title=Goosebumps | work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]] | publisher=[[Flixster]] | accessdate=April 29, 2016}} On [[Metacritic]], the film has a score of 60 out of 100 based on 29 critics, indicating "mixed or average reviews".{{cite web | url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/goosebumps | title=Goosebumps reviews | work=[[Metacritic]] | publisher=[[CBS Interactive]] | accessdate=February 4, 2016}} Audiences polled by [[CinemaScore]] gave the film an average grade of "A" on an A+ to F scale.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/10/goosebumps-bridge-of-spies-crimson-peak-weekend-box-office-1201585023/ |title='Goosebumps' Raises Hair At The B.O., While 'Crimson Peak's Recedes |website=Deadline Hollywood}} Kevin P. Sullivan of ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' gave the film a B rating, citing at the end of his review: "Nothing about ''Goosebumps'' is revolutionary—at a certain point you may realize that it's as if [[Nickelodeon]] produced ''[[The Cabin in the Woods|Cabin in the Woods]]''—but it's a never-boring trip to a world, where stories and imagination are powerful tools, that just might inspire kids to do the scariest thing of all: pick up a book".{{cite web | url=http://www.ew.com/article/2015/10/09/goosebumps-ew-review | title='Goosebumps': EW review | work=Kevin P. Sullivan | publisher=[[Entertainment Weekly]] | date=October 9, 2015 | accessdate=October 11, 2015}} ===Accolades=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Award ! Category ! Recipient ! Result |- | Las Vegas Film Critics Society[http://awardswatch.com/news/las-vegas-film-critics-go-all-in-on-creed-beasts-of-no-nation-snub-saoirse-ronan-carol/ Las Vegas Film Critics Go All In on Creed, Beasts of No Nation; Snub Saoirse Ronan, Carol] | Best Family Film ! | {{nom}} |- | [[Visual Effects Society Awards 2015|Visual Effects Society]] | Outstanding Visual Effects in a Special Venue Project | Jason Schugardt, Mike Wigart, Alex Harding, Daniel Mars | {{nom}} |- | [[42nd Saturn Awards|Saturn Awards]]{{cite web|url=http://www.saturnawards.org/|title=The 42nd Annual Saturn Awards nominations are announced for 2016!|publisher=[[Saturn Award]]s|date=February 24, 2016|accessdate=March 4, 2016}} | [[Saturn Award for Best Fantasy Film|Best Fantasy Film]] | | {{nom}} |} ==Sequel== {{ main |Goosebumps 2: Haunted Halloween}} On September 2, 2015, it was reported that a [[sequel]] was in the planning stages, with Sony looking for a screenwriter.{{cite web |url=http://www.cinemablend.com/new/Goosebumps-2-Happening-Get-Details-80667.html | title=Goosebumps 2 Is Happening, Get The Details | publisher=Cinema Blend | date=September 2, 2015 | access-date=September 3, 2015 | author=McKnight, Brent}} On January 17, 2017, a January 26, 2018, release date was set and [[Rob Letterman]] confirmed that he is to return as director for the sequel.{{cite web|last1=Evry|first1=Max|title=Goosebumps 2 Release Date Set By Sony Pictures|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/804137-goosebumps-2-release-date-set-by-sony-pictures|publisher=ComingSoon.net|access-date=January 18, 2017|date=January 17, 2017}} On February 6, 2017, it was announced that the film's release date has been delayed to September 21, 2018, taking the place of the release date previously held by ''[[Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/811563-sony-pictures-2018-schedule#/slide/1|title=Sony Pictures 2018 Schedule Shifts Hotel Transylvania, Bad Boys, Goosebumps and More|date=February 6, 2017|access-date=February 7, 2017}} In May 2017, the title was revealed to be ''Goosebumps: Horror Land''.{{Cite news|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/849929-goosebumps-2-title-revealed-plus-promo-art-for-jumanji-grinch-and-more#/slide/2|title=Goosebumps 2 Title Revealed, Plus Promo Art for More!|date=2017-05-18|work=ComingSoon.net|access-date=2017-05-18|language=en-US}} It was confirmed that Jack Black will reprise his role as R.L. Stine. It has also been confirmed that Odeya Rush will return as Hannah Fairchild, R.L Stine’s daughter from the first film.{{cite web|url=http://bloody-disgusting.com/news/3441519/jack-black-will-back-goosebumps-horrorland|title=Jack Black Will Be Back in 'Goosebumps: Horrorland'|date=June 12, 2017}} However, it was confirmed that the sequel will not feature any of the original cast. In November 2017, Rob Lieber was tapped to pen the script.{{cite web|last=Lang|first=Brent|url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/sony-taps-rob-lieber-to-write-goosebumps-2-script-1202605455/amp/|title=''Sony'' Taps Rob Lieber To Write ''Goosebumps 2'' Script|date=November 2, 2017|publisher=''Variety''|access-date=December 7, 2017}} Shortly after [[Ari Sandel]] was announced as Letterman's replacement as director. ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' reported that two scripts have been written. One script has Black reprising his role, while the other has Black cut out entirely.{{cite web|last=Lang|first=Brent|url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/goosebumps-2-jack-black-1202637463/|title=Ari Sandel Will Direct ''Goosebumps 2''|date=December 12, 2017|publisher=''Variety''|access-date=December 12, 2017}} In December 2017, the sequel's release date was pushed to October 12, 2018.{{cite web |last=D'Alessandro |first=Anthony |date=December 28, 2017 |title=Sony Moves ‘Alpha’ To Fall, Bumps ‘Goosebumps 2’ To October|url=http://deadline.com/2017/12/jack-black-goosebumps-2-alpha-new-release-dates-1202233292/|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |access-date=December 29, 2017}} Production began on February 25, 2018,{{cite web|url=https://www.backstage.com/news/casting/jack-black-gets-goosebumps-again/|title=Jack Black Gets Goosebumps Again|website=Backstage.com|access-date=February 7, 2018}} Jack Black will return in the sequel, making his characters the only one from the previous film to return.{{cite web|url=http://bloody-disgusting.com/movie/3480724/goosebumps-slappys-revenge-plot-details-tease-halloween-night-apocalypse/|title='Goosebumps: Slappy's Revenge' Plot Details Tease Halloween Night Apocalypse - Bloody Disgusting|website=Bloody-Disgusting.com|access-date=February 7, 2018}} New cast members include [[Madison Iseman]], Ben O'Brien, [[Caleel Harris]], and [[Jeremy Ray Taylor]].{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2018/film/news/goosebumps-sequel-sony-cast-1202708209/|title=‘Goosebumps’ Sequel Sets Ensemble Cast|website=Variety|last=Kroll|first=Justin|date=February 22, 2018|accessdate=February 22, 2018}} [[Ken Jeong]], [[Chris Parnell]], and [[Wendi McLendon-Covey]] joined the following month.{{cite web|url=https://screenrant.com/goosebumps-2-jeong-parnell-mclendon-covey-cast/|title=Goosebumps 2 Casts Ken Jeong, Chris Parnell, & Wendi McLendon-Covey|website=Screen Rant|last=Tyler|first=Adrienne|date=March 5, 2018|accessdate=March 5, 2018}} Filming officially began on March 7, 2018, and in April 2018 the new title was announced as ''[[Goosebumps 2: Haunted Halloween]]''.http://bloody-disgusting.com/movie/3495212/goosebumps-sequel-now-titled-haunted-halloween/ ==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== {{Wikiquote}} {{commons category|Goosebumps Panel at the 2014 Comic-Con International}} * {{Official website|http://www.thegoosebumpsmovie.net/}} * {{IMDb title|1051904}} * {{Mojo title|goosebumps}} * {{Rotten Tomatoes|goosebumps_2015}} * {{Metacritic film|goosebumps}} {{Rob Letterman}} {{Sony Pictures Animation}} {{Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski}} {{R. L. revision.comment: copy edit with [[Wikipedia:AutoWikiBrowser/General_fixes|General fixes]]; url trimming of identifying info per[[WP:LINKSTOAVOID]] and [[Template:Citation_Style_documentation#url|Citation Style]], replaced: ’ → ' (32), As of February 2015 → {{a
revision.text:
{{for|the French chef|Guy Martin (chef)}} {{multiple issues| {{very long|rps=114|date=October 2018}} {{Overly detailed|date=May 2016}} {{fanpov|date=June 2016}} {{advert|date=June 2016}} }} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2015}} {{Use British English|date=January 2015}} {{Infobox motorcycle rider | name = Guy Martin | image = Guy.Martin.JPG | caption = Martin at the 2014 [[Bol d'Or]] | nationality = British | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1981|11|4|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Grimsby]], [[Lincolnshire]], England | Current team = None | nicknames = None | TT Contested = 14 (2003–2015, 2017) | TT Wins = 0 | TT Podiums = 17 <ref name="Race results"/> }}
'''Guy Martin''' (born 4 November 1981) is a British [[lorry]]-mechanic better known publicly as a [[motorcycle racing|motorcycle]] racer turned television presenter of engineering-based projects, being likened to the late [[Fred Dibnah]].<ref>[https://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/life/features/guy-martin-hes-most-comfortable-fixing-lorries-but-tv-has-propelled-the-charming-road-racer-to-fame-and-fortune-31452475.html Guy Martin: He's most comfortable fixing lorries but TV has propelled the charming road racer to fame and fortune] ''[[Belfast Telegraph]]'', 15 August 2015. Retrieved 4 June 2018</ref>
Martin started racing in 1998, debuting on [[road racing|road circuits]] at the [[Isle of Man TT]] events in 2004,<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://www.driving.co.uk/news/guy-martin-on-his-volvo-fastest-car-in-britain/|title=Guy Martin on his Volvo: the fastest car in Britain|website=Sunday Times Driving|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-03-31}}</ref> where he gained 17 podium finishes.<ref name="Race results">[https://www.iomtt.com/TT-Database/Events/Races.aspx?meet_code=ALL&ride_id=8430 Race results: Guy Martin] IoM tt.com official website. Retrieved 19 February 2018</ref> He has broken his back twice in racing accidents,<ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/tvandradio/12041371/Guy-Martin-my-grandfather-fought-for-the-Nazis.html|title=Guy Martin: my grandfather fought for the Nazis|website=Telegraph.co.uk|access-date=2016-04-01}}</ref> in the 2010 TT and the 2015 [[Ulster Grand Prix]].
Following the Ulster Grand Prix accident, Martin stated that he had retired from motorcycle racing although he never disclosed the decision publicly.<ref name="bennetts.co.uk">{{cite web|url=https://www.bennetts.co.uk/bikesocial/news-and-views/racing/isle-of-man-tt/news/guy-martin-i-should-have-quit-the-tt-four-years-ago?cid=sm_000001|title="I never said this publicly but I had finished racing"|first=Michael|last=Mann|publisher=}}</ref> However following numerous approaches by Honda Racing team manager Neil Tuxworth,<ref name="bennetts.co.uk"/> Martin confirmed in January 2017 that he had signed for Lincolnshire-based Honda Racing as partner to 23-times TT winner [[John McGuinness (motorcycle racer)|John McGuinness]] for the [[North West 200]], [[Isle of Man TT]] and [[Southern 100]] races.<ref name="itv.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.itv.com/news/granada/2017-01-18/honda-confirms-guy-martin-and-john-mcguiness-for-iom-tt-2017/|title=Honda confirms Guy Martin and John McGuinness for IoM TT 2017|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.motorcyclenews.com/sport/tt-road-races/2017/january/roads-guy-martin-in-shock-tt-return-with-honda-racing/|title=Roads: Guy Martin in shock TT return with Honda Racing|newspaper=Motorcycle News|language=en|access-date=2017-01-18}}</ref>
It was a disappointing campaign with the then-new version of the [[Honda CBR1000RR#2017 redesign|Honda Fireblade]]. After crashing heavily with gearbox trouble in the Superbike TT race, Martin gained a second-place finish in the [[TT Zero#2017 TT Zero Race|TT Zero]] race for electrically-powered machines on the (Honda) [[Mugen Motorsports#Mugen|Mugen]].
[[Motorcycle News]] announced his retirement from motorcycle road racing on 26 July 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.motorcyclenews.com/sport/tt-road-races/2017/july/roads-guy-martin-calls-time-on-road-racing/|title=Exclusive: Guy Martin calls time on road racing|publisher=}}</ref> Martin immediately refuted this in a statement on his official website " ...I've not given up on racing or road racing, there's no unfinished business and I want to race classics and oddball stuff."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://guymartinracing.co.uk/a-word-from-guy/|title=A word from Guy - Guy Martin Racing|date=2017-07-26|work=Guy Martin Racing|access-date=2017-08-02|language=en-GB}}</ref>
In August 2017, [[Formula One|Formula 1]] car team [[Williams Grand Prix Engineering|Williams]] announced that Martin would join their [[Pit stop|pit-crew]] for the impending [[Belgian Grand Prix|Belgian GP]].<ref>[http://www.williamsf1.com/racing/news/guy-martin-to-join-williams-martini-racing-pit-crew-for-the-belgian-gp Guy Martin to join Williams Martini Racing Pit Crew for the Belgian GP] williamsf1.com, 23 August 2017. Retrieved 23 August 2017</ref>
Martin starred in ''[[TT3D: Closer to the Edge|Closer to the Edge]]'', a 2011 documentary on TT racing. He has since presented programmes on various engineering topics and the [[Channel 4]] series ''Speed with Guy Martin'' when he set speed records in a variety of human and engine powered vehicles. He has authored three books, and competed in [[mountain bike]] pedal-cycle races.
His first job after leaving school was as a heavy vehicle mechanic, which he retained since, being unwilling to give it up for full-time racing and media.
{{TOC limit}}
==Early life== Martin was born on 4 November 1981 in a suburb of [[Grimsby]], [[Lincolnshire]], England.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/profiles/guy-martin-profile-jeremy-clarkson-s-perfect-replacement-on-top-gear-10237190.html|title=Guy Martin profile: Jeremy Clarkson's perfect replacement on Top Gear|website=The Independent|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-03-31}}</ref> He was named Guy in tribute to [[Guy Gibson]] of [[No. 617 Squadron RAF]].<ref name=":92">{{Cite web|url=http://www.motorcyclenews.com/news/2014/december/no-one-has-ever-done-100mph-on-the-wall-of-death-so-we-are-going-to-give-it-a-go/|title=No one has ever done 100mph on the wall of death, so we are going to give it a go|website=Motorcycle News|access-date=2016-04-02}}</ref> His father Ian was a successful privateer motorbike racer who had competed in several [[Isle of Man TT]] events, but he was forced to supplement his income with a job as a lorry mechanic, additionally selling bikes. His mother, Rita Kidals, was of [[Latvia]]n heritage, her father having come to Britain in 1947 as a [[political refugee]]. Soon after Martin's birth, the family moved to a house outside the town, where they remained, having four children in total.
Martin had shown an interest in working on trucks as early as age 12.<ref name=":3">{{Cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/profiles/guy-martin-profile-jeremy-clarkson-s-perfect-replacement-on-top-gear-10237190.html|title=Guy Martin profile: Jeremy Clarkson's perfect replacement on Top|website=The Independent|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-04-01}}</ref> As a child he was fascinated by engines, and would take apart lawnmowers to try to make them go faster. Although his interest matched his father's trade, he was happy for Guy to do his own thing, and indeed would try to stop him "talking the whole time about engines" during family holidays to [[Butlins]].<ref name="telegraph.co.uk">{{Cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/the-filter/10555336/Sideburns-and-spanners-Guy-Martin-interview.html|title=Sideburns and spanners: Guy Martin interview|website=Telegraph.co.uk|access-date=2016-04-07}}</ref>
Martin attended [[Kirmington]] Church of England Primary School and [[The Vale Academy]] school, leaving at age 16. He then enrolled in [[North Lindsey College]] on a motor vehicle engineering course, believing at the time that it was appropriate as further education was what everybody did. He quickly realised it was not for him – he was not being paid and was being taught things he either already knew, or thought would never need, and so decided to leave after a month, having secured an apprenticeship as a truck fitter with a [[Volvo]] centre, John Hebb Volvo.<ref name=":6">{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=YCCrCQAAQBAJ|title=Guy Martin: My Autobiography|last=Martin|first=Guy|date=2015-05-21|publisher=Virgin Books|isbn=9780753555033|pages=52–54|language=en}}</ref>
Martin and his siblings attended every Isle of Man TT from their births, until their father Ian crashed his [[Yamaha FZ750]] whilst racing at [[Oliver's Mount]], [[Scarborough, North Yorkshire|Scarborough]] in 1988, when Guy was aged 7.<ref>{{cite book|title=My Autobiography|last=Martin|first=Guy|page=47|year=2014|isbn=978-0-7535-5502-6}}</ref> After recovering from the resulting broken hip, Martin's father did not race again, but worked as a mechanic in classic bike racing.<ref>{{cite book|title=My Autobiography|last=Martin|first=Guy|page=52|year=2014|isbn=978-0-7535-5502-6}}</ref>
== Career ==
=== Racing === While completing his apprenticeship as a lorry mechanic, Martin raced motorbikes in his spare time.<ref name=":3" /> Martin returned to the Isle of Man at age 16; overhearing lorry driver and amateur racer Baz Kirk discussing his plans to race in the 1997 [[Manx Grand Prix]] with his father, he was offered the chance to assist him as a race mechanic.<ref name=":6" />
Martin decided to take up racing after a crash on public roads at age 18.<ref name="About Guy">{{Cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/programmes/guy-martins-passion-for-life/articles/all/about-guy|title=About Guy|website=Channel 4|access-date=2016-04-09}}</ref> He moved to [[Ireland]] to join Team Racing. In 2004 he moved to the Uel Duncan Racing team, staying with them until 2005. In 2006 Martin raced for Alistair Flanagan's [[Yamaha Motor Company#Motorcycle racing highlights|AIM Yamaha]] race team, replacing [[John McGuinness (motorcycle racer)|John McGuinness]]. In the search for a more competitive team, Martin joined Hydrex Honda for the 2007 season.
The end of 2009 saw Martin leave Hydrex for Northern Ireland-based Wilson Craig Honda, but since November 2010, Martin has raced for [[TAS Racing]] (known as [[Relentless (drink)|Relentless]] [[Suzuki]], then [[Tyco International|Tyco]] Suzuki from 2012 to 2014, and Tyco [[BMW]] from 2015 to present), the team run by the Neill family also based in Northern Ireland, and with a long TT heritage. This switch to what was effectively a factory team meant the end of tuning his own equipment – for TAS he would simply be riding pre-prepared machines.<ref name="mbr.co.uk">{{Cite web|url=http://www.mbr.co.uk/news/trail_news/feature-riding-with-tt-ace-guy-martin-313979|title=Guy Martin: Riding with the Isle of Man TT ace - MBR|website=MBR|language=en-US|access-date=2016-04-09}}</ref>
Martin agreed a new deal for 2015 with TAS after the team agreed a new equipment deal with [[BMW Motorrad]], to ride the [[BMW S1000RR]] alongside [[William Dunlop (motorcycle racer)|William Dunlop]].<ref name="BBC29777669">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/northern-ireland/29777669|title=BBC Sport - TAS team set to link up with BMW for road race season|work=BBC Sport}}</ref> Martin was prepared to retire had TAS not chosen to switch to BMW, believing he had raced the Suzuki as hard as he could.<ref name=":92" /><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/motorsport/30536376|title=BBC Sport - Isle of Man TT 2015: Guy Martin 'excited' by BMW TT package|work=BBC Sport}}</ref> With the new bike, he ran his fastest ever lap of the TT circuit in June 2015 – 132.398 mph – just outside the outright lap record.<ref name=":17">{{Cite web|url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/sport/motorcycling/end-of-the-road-for-guy-martin-as-he-skips-north-west-200-and-isle-of-man-tt-34380128.html|title=End of the road for Guy Martin as he skips North West 200 and Isle of Man TT - BelfastTelegraph.co.uk|website=BelfastTelegraph.co.uk|access-date=2016-04-09}}</ref>
Martin suffered a serious crash in the Dundrod 150 Superbike event, part of the [[Ulster Grand Prix]] races in August 2015.<ref name=":8" /> Following the crash, Martin only got back on his racing motorbike in March 2016, for the filming of the F1 special for his ''Speed'' series.<ref name=":18">{{Cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/tv/2016/03/13/david-coulthard-and-guy-martin-interview-the-boy-racers-who-turn/|title=David Coulthard and Guy Martin, interview: the boy racers who turned down Top Gear|website=The Telegraph|access-date=2016-04-08}}</ref>
In other motorbike events, he has purchased a [[Honda CRF450]] with the intention of racing in the [[Superprestigio Dirt Track|Superprestigio Open]], and he also intends to compete in the [[Paris Dakar Rally]] at some point.<ref name=":92" />
Since 2011, he has also got into bicycle racing, in 24-hour events.<ref name="telegraph.co.uk"/><ref name=":21">{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2014/dec/07/guy-martin-bike-racer-isle-of-man-tt-speed-with-guy-martin-channel-4|title='I love racing because it can kill you,' says bike racer Guy Martin|last=Lamont|first=Tom|date=2014-12-07|newspaper=The Guardian|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077|access-date=2016-04-08}}</ref> For the 2016 season Martin decided not to race in the TT for the first time in 11 years, opting instead for a mountain bike race. He was uncertain if the decision would lead him to retire from road racing, mountain bike racing, or if he would go on to do something else, but said "if I do race on the roads it will be with TAS".<ref name=":17" />
Martin signed a new deal with Honda Racing on 18 January 2017 to ride the Honda CBR1000RR Fireblade SP2, rekindling his ambition to win the Isle of Man TT and renewing his focus on his road racing career.<ref name=":182">{{Cite web|url=http://www.commercialmotor.com/news/guy-martin-signs-new-team-tt|title=Guy Martin signs with new team for TT|website=Commercial Motor|access-date=2017-01-18}}</ref>
=== Television === Martin first came to the attention of TV executives in 2009 when he appeared in an ITV4 programme intended primarily for fans of that year's TT race. The then film-producer, Andy Spellman, filmed with Guy at the TT. Spellman shot some additional test material of Martin back at home in the summer and the boss of North One television showed the clips to a BBC executive.<ref name=":3" />
Having engaged Andy Spellman as his advisor and agent in 2009, Martin worked with North One TV Producers James Woodroffe and Ewan Keil, as he has done to present day. Martin's first appearances on TV documentaries were on programmes based around his passion for engineering rather than his love of adrenaline sport, ''The Boat that Guy Built'' airing on the BBC in 2011, and ''How Britain Worked'' on Channel 4 in 2012.<ref name=":3" /> His thrill-seeking side later emerged with the production of the series ''Speed with Guy Martin'', first airing on Channel 4 in 2013.<ref name=":3" /> Uncomfortable with presenting to camera or working from a script, his preferred style is to improvise his dialogue, and work by responding to questions from crew off camera, which are designed both to prompt him, as well as keep him focused, and even stop him "rattling on" if necessary.<ref name=":92" />
He later turned down an invitation from [[Chris Evans (presenter)|Chris Evans]] to join the new presenting team of the BBC's motoring show, ''[[Top Gear (2002 TV series)|Top Gear]]''.<ref name=":4" /> He stated "With the programmes I do on Channel 4 I'm wagging my own tail, not having it wagged for me."<ref name=":4" />
Despite enjoying the work, due to the amount of time it was taking to film his ''Speed'' series, time taken away from his maintenance job, Martin considered taking a break from television in 2015. He changed his mind after reaching a deal to film the India and wall of death programmes, and possibly a few more one-off ''Speed'' specials, including an unstated record in Europe.<ref name=":92" /> His August 2015 crash pushed back the planned date for his Wall of Death show, from 4 October.<ref name=":275">{{Cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/other-sports/british-superbikes/bike-legend-guy-martin-believes-6805877|title=Guy Martin believes if he reaches age 40 he'll 'have done alright'|last=Fox-Leonard|first=Boudicca|website=mirror|access-date=2016-04-09}}</ref>
=== Writing === Martin has written three books about his life, releasing his [[autobiography]], ''Guy Martin: My Autobiography, on'' 8 May 2014.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=BHKnAgAAQBAJ|title=Guy Martin: My Autobiography|last=Martin|first=Guy|date=2014-05-08|publisher=Random House|isbn=9780753549957|language=en}}</ref> It reached No.1 in the ''Sunday Times'' bestseller list and remained there for at least six weeks,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.thesundaytimes.co.uk/sto/news/uk_news/People/article1425446.ece|title=Grimsby biker's bestseller puts a spanner in the literati|website=www.thesundaytimes.co.uk|access-date=2016-03-31}}</ref> and eventually became the second best selling autobiography of 2014.<ref name=":3" /> This was followed by ''Guy Martin: When You Dead, You Dead,'' released on 22 October 2015, and covering the previous year in diary format, from the 24-hour Solo World Mountain Bike Championship to the Isle of Man TT.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=xknJCgAAQBAJ|title=Guy Martin: When You Dead, You Dead|last=Martin|first=Guy|date=2015-10-22|publisher=Ebury Publishing|isbn=9780753556764|language=en}}</ref> It was listed No.1 in online retailer [[Amazon.com|Amazon]]'s sales figures for celebrity autobiographies in November 2015, with his main autobiography being No.10.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/shopping/esbest/bestselling-celebrity-autobiographies-of-2015-revealed-by-amazon-uk-a3133791.html|title=Bestselling celebrity autobiographies of 2015|website=Evening Standard|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-03-31}}</ref> October 2016 saw the release of his latest book, titled "Guy Martin: Worms to Catch" featuring Guy's thoughts on the past year and upcoming challenges.
Martin is also listed as the author of companion books for some of his television shows: ''How Britain Worked,'' published on 4 October 2012<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=gMHaKbWZ7TsC|title=How Britain Worked|last=Martin|first=Guy|date=2012-01-01|publisher=Ebury Publishing|isbn=9780753540848|language=en}}</ref> and ''Speed'', published on 1 December 2013.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Bm7ClQEACAAJ|title=Speed: How to Make Things Go Really Fast|last=Martin|first=Guy|date=2013-12-01|publisher=Ebury Publishing|isbn=9780753541067|language=en}}</ref>
Martin also writes for the driving section of ''[[The Sunday Times]]'' newspaper.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.driving.co.uk/contributors/guy-martin/|title=Guy Martin, Contributors, Sunday Times Driving|website=Sunday Times Driving|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-04-08}}</ref> He has written car reviews on the 2015 Aston Martin Vanquish Carbon,<ref name=":19">{{Cite web|url=http://www.driving.co.uk/car-reviews/guy-martin-drives-aston-martin-vanquish-carbon-edition-2015/|title=Guy Martin drives Aston Martin Vanquish Carbon Edition (2015)|website=Sunday Times Driving|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-04-08}}</ref> the 2015 Range Rover Sport SVR,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.driving.co.uk/car-reviews/guy-martin-drives-range-rover-sport-svr-2015/|title=Guy Martin drives Range Rover Sport SVR (2015)|website=Sunday Times Driving|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-04-08}}</ref> the 2015 Ford Transit L2 H2, the 2016 Ford Mustang V8 GT,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.driving.co.uk/car-reviews/guy-martin-reviews-the-2016-ford-mustang-gt/|title=Guy Martin reviews the 2016 Ford Mustang GT|website=Sunday Times Driving|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-04-08}}</ref> as well as writing about his own Volvo Vöx<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.driving.co.uk/news/guy-martin-on-his-volvo-fastest-car-in-britain/|title=Guy Martin on his Volvo: the fastest car in Britain|website=Sunday Times Driving|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-04-08}}</ref> and his Wall of Death show.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.driving.co.uk/news/the-wall-of-death-guy-martins-biggest-challenge-yet/|title=The Wall of Death: Guy Martin's biggest challenge yet|website=Sunday Times Driving|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-04-08}}</ref>
=== Truck maintenance and other work === In addition to his television and racing activities, Martin has continued to work as a truck fitter. He currently works for Moody International, a Scania centre in [[Grimsby]], working Monday to Fridays, while also regularly working overtime shifts on Saturdays.<ref name="driving.co.uk" /> He only takes short periods off to race or do television work, and on his return ensures he starts early to make up for the time lost.<ref name=":3" /> He also earns money by tuning fellow racer's bikes in the evenings.<ref name=":20">{{Cite web|url=http://www.mbr.co.uk/news/trail_news/feature-riding-with-tt-ace-guy-martin-313979|title=Guy Martin: Riding with the Isle of Man TT ace - MBR|website=MBR|language=en-US|access-date=2016-04-08}}</ref> He also takes casual work during TT race weeks.<ref name="telegraph.co.uk"/> Eager to keep his options open, he has even bought a tractor, using it on biomass farms for seasonal muck-spreading at night.<ref name=":275"/>
On his apprenticeship, he earned £300 a week working a 60-hour week plus 10 hours' overtime on Saturdays, while also attending classroom-based training at college on a day release basis. He also supplemented his income working for his father, who at the time was self-employed, running a truck maintenance business.<ref name=":6" /> As well as his truck job, in his early career he also financed his racing with evening shifts at Chicago Rock Café and weekend work at [[Port of Grimsby|Grimbsy docks]].<ref name=":20"/> After his apprenticeship, Martin then worked for his father at the local [[Scania AB|Scania]] garage.
Due to the filming commitments for ''The Boat that Guy Built'', he ended up losing his job working for his father, but immediately went into town to apply for another truck job.<ref name=":16">{{Cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/tvandradio/9614490/How-Britain-Worked-Channel-4-Preview.html|title=How Britain Worked, Channel 4, Preview|website=Telegraph.co.uk|access-date=2016-04-07}}</ref>
== Speed records == Martin has set the following speed records. {| class="wikitable" !Record !Issuer !Speed !Location !Date !Previous holder !Ref. |- |Fastest speed on a gravity powered snow sled |Guinness World Records |134.368 km/h (83.49 mph) |Grandvalira, Andorra |10 January 2014 |62.25 mph (Rolf Allerdissen, 2010) |<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/news/2014/1/video-watch-guy-martin-speeds-to-sled-world-record-54549/|title=Video: Watch Guy Martin speed to sled world record|website=Guinness World Records|access-date=2016-04-02}}</ref> |- |Fastest speed in a soapbox |Guinness World Records |137.78 km/h (85.61 mph) |Mont Ventoux, France |16 October 2014 | |<ref name=":7">{{Cite web|url=http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/news/2016/3/british-motorcycle-racer-guy-martin-smashes-world-record-reaching-78-mph-on-wall-422470|title=British motorcycle racer Guy Martin smashes Wall of Death world record after reaching 78 mph|website=Guinness World Records|access-date=2016-04-02}}</ref> |- |Highest speed on a [[Wall of death|Wall of Death]] |Guinness World Records |125.77 km/h (78.15 mph) |Manby Airfield, UK |28 March 2016 |created for the attempt |<ref name=":7" /> |- |Fastest [[hovercraft]] |British record |121.04 km/h (75.21 mph) |Loch Ken, UK |8 October 2014 | |<ref name="McNair">{{Cite web|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/news/local-news/guy-martin-fails-bid-break-4620781#2bg08al9VpQEvMi3.97|title=Speedster comes up short in record attempt|last=McNair|first=Andrew|website=dailyrecord|access-date=2016-04-04}}</ref> |} In July 2015 it was confirmed that Martin was to pilot [[Triumph Motorcycles Ltd|Triumph Motorcycles']] attempt on the [[Motorcycle land-speed record|motorcycle land speed record]] (World's Fastest Motorcycle), at the time standing at 376.363 mph (605 km/h), set by Rocky Robinson in 2010. The attempt was originally scheduled for August during the [[Fédération Internationale de Motocyclisme|FIM]] event at [[Bonneville Salt Flats]] in the United States. Competing in the Division C (streamlined motorcycle) category, the [[Triumph Rocket|Triumph Rocket Streamliner]] is 25.5 feet long, powered by two turbocharged, methanol fuelled, [[Triumph Rocket III]] engines, enclosed in a carbon Kevlar monocoque.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-isle-of-man-33505344|title=Guy Martin to attempt 400mph land speed record|website=BBC News|access-date=2016-04-02}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://blog.motorcycle.com/2015/07/09/racing/guy-martin-joins-triumph-in-attempt-to-reclaim-land-speed-record/|title=Guy Martin Joins Triumph in Attempt to Reclaim Land Speed Record - Motorcycle.com News|access-date=2016-04-02}}</ref> A documentary about the attempt was made for Channel 4.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/info/press/news/guy-martin-and-triumph-attempt-to-bring-the-record-back-home/|title=Guy Martin and Triumph Attempt to Bring the Record Back Home - Channel 4 - Info - Press|website=www.channel4.com|access-date=2016-04-02}}</ref> His August 2015 crash at the Ulster GP caused the attempt to be postponed until September 2016.<ref name=":8">[http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/sport/motorcycling/guy-martins-world-record-bid-shelved-until-2016-following-ulster-grand-prix-crash-31451601.html Guy Martin's world record bid shelved until 2016 following Ulster Grand Prix crash] ''Belfast Telegraph'' 14 August 2015, Retrieved 22 August 2015</ref>
Martin's quest to set a new two-wheeled world land speed record was called off due to conditions on the course. The attempt, on the purpose-built 400 mph motorcycle, suffered a number of setbacks at the track at Bonneville Salt Flats, in Utah, USA.
The streamliner tipped over when it passed over a rut in the track as it was being towed to the start line. Triumph said rain meant it was not possible to create the required-consistency across the 11-mile course necessary to undertake the attempt. On 18 September 2016, Martin had hoped to complete a required 300 mph trial run before attempting to set a new world record.
A mile into the run the machine lost traction on the damp surface, veering off the steered path and tipping over on the course. Martin was confirmed to be "completely uninjured" and the record attempt was postponed once more.
== Public perception and critical reception == Reviewing ''Closer to the Edge'', his breakthrough appearance,<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":4" /> [[Peter Bradshaw]] of ''The Guardian'' said: "What could have been a pretty dull film just for motorbike fans and devotees of the Isle of Man TT race, achieves real human interest and excitement due partly to a focus on one competitor: likable motormouth Guy Martin."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2011/apr/21/tt3d-closer-to-the-edge|title=TT3D: Closer to the Edge – review|last=Bradshaw|first=Peter|date=2011-04-21|newspaper=The Guardian|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077|access-date=2016-04-09}}</ref> TV reviewers before and since have noted his gentle but gritty, spontaneous, direct, earthy and blokey style, his infectious enthusiasm, natural talent, nice turn of phrase, and engaging features.<ref name=":4" /><ref name=":16"/><ref name=":24">{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2012/nov/11/tv-review-time-team-forgotten-gunners-ww1|title=TV review: The Forgotten Gunners of WW1 – A Time Team Special; How Britain Worked|last=Wollaston|first=Sam|date=2012-11-11|newspaper=The Guardian|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077|access-date=2016-04-09}}</ref><ref name=":23">{{Cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/tv/2016/03/13/david-coulthard-and-guy-martin-interview-the-boy-racers-who-turn/|title=David Coulthard and Guy Martin, interview: the boy racers who turned down Top Gear|website=The Telegraph|access-date=2016-04-09}}</ref><ref name=":5">{{Cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/tvandradio/tv-and-radio-reviews/12050395/Our-Guy-in-Latvia-channel-4-review.html|title=Our Guy in Latvia, Channel 4, review: 'the magic was missing'|website=Telegraph.co.uk|access-date=2016-04-01}}</ref><ref name=":26">{{Cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/profiles/guy-martin-profile-jeremy-clarkson-s-perfect-replacement-on-top-gear-10237190.html|title=Guy Martin profile: Jeremy Clarkson's perfect replacement on Top|website=The Independent|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-04-09}}</ref> It has been suggested he brings something unique to presenting,<ref name=":4" /><ref name=":24"/> with comparisons being made with the late [[Fred Dibnah]].<ref name=":16"/><ref name=":28">{{Cite web|url=http://www.driving.co.uk/news/guy-martin-on-his-indian-motorbike-adventure/|title=Guy Martin on his Indian motorbike adventure|website=Sunday Times Driving|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-04-09}}</ref> In reviewing his subsequent work after he turned down the ''Top Gear'' presenting role, critics have lamented what might have been.<ref name=":4" /><ref name=":18"/><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/tv/2016/03/17/guy-martin-not-chris-evans-should-have-been-the-new-top-gear-pre/|title=Guy Martin, not Chris Evans, should have been the new Top Gear presenter – review|website=The Telegraph|access-date=2016-04-08}}</ref> According to Jasper Rees of ''The Daily Telegraph'', it is his "combination of eccentricity and humility that makes him so popular with viewers".<ref name=":4" />
The wider media have picked up on his views, interests, reluctance to be famous and "simple" lifestyle,<ref name=":4" /><ref name=":2"/> leading to descriptions of Martin as a "working-class hero".<ref name=":23"/> Among racing fans, Martin is seen as something of a cult hero<ref name=":16"/> Described as the most famous racer never to have won the TT, he is credited with opening up road racing to a diverse global audience in the modern era.<ref name=":17" /> Inside the racing paddock, Martin is seen as somewhat of an outsider or maverick, which he is comfortable with.<ref name=":2"/> On joining TAS racing in 2011, team manager Philip Neill praised his enthusiasm and free spirit attitude, commenting "He's created a Guy Martin brand without even trying and that's also pretty special," while also observing his commitment to do things their way.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.iomtt.com/News/2010/11/03/Guy-Martin-joins-TAS-Suzuki-for-2011-Isle-of-Man-TT.aspx|title=Guy Martin joins TAS Suzuki for 2011 Isle of Man TT - Isle of Man TT Official Website|website=www.iomtt.com|access-date=2016-04-11}}</ref>
Various commentators have also drawn attention to his [[sideburns]], worn since age 16,<ref name=":4" /><ref name=":2"/><ref name=":23"/><ref name=":28"/><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/the-filter/10555336/Sideburns-and-spanners-Guy-Martin-interview.html|title=Sideburns and spanners: Guy Martin interview|website=Telegraph.co.uk|access-date=2016-03-31}}</ref><ref name=":24"/> his use of phrases such as "graft" (work) and "proper"<ref name=":24"/> as well as his addiction to drinking tea<ref name="mbr.co.uk"/><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2014/dec/07/guy-martin-bike-racer-isle-of-man-tt-speed-with-guy-martin-channel-4|title='I love racing because it can kill you,' says bike racer Guy Martin|last=Lamont|first=Tom|date=2014-12-07|newspaper=The Guardian|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077|access-date=2016-04-09}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.motorcyclenews.com/news/2011/november/nov1611-guy-martin-creates-own-tea-blend-with-competition-winner/|title=Guy Martin creates own tea blend with competition winner|website=Motorcycle News|access-date=2016-04-09}}</ref> – his on screen explaining of the reasons for why he prefers to put the milk in first was part of what drew him to the attention of his eventual television producer Woodroffe.<ref name=":26"/>
Items owned by Martin were loaned to the [[Grampian Transport Museum]] in [[Alford, Aberdeenshire]] to display as part of their 2016 season. He had previously visited the museum in 2011. It featured his [[Rolls-Royce Merlin|Merlin]] engine, three of his favourite motorcycles, and the gravity racer used in his ''Speed'' series. The bikes were the one he built for the Pike's Peak episode of ''Speed'', his 2003 Suzuki GSXR 1000 K3 (his most used and most prolific race-winning bike) and the 675 Daytona Triumph used in the 2015 TT Supersport races.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.gtm.org.uk/news/guy-martin-collection-to-go-on-show-in-2016/|title=Guy Martin collection to go on display - Grampian Transport Museum|website=www.gtm.org.uk|access-date=2016-04-08|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160331105010/http://www.gtm.org.uk/news/guy-martin-collection-to-go-on-show-in-2016|archivedate=31 March 2016|df=dmy-all}}</ref> According to the museum's curator, this was the "first time anywhere that anybody has presented an exhibition of Guy Martin's engineering items".<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pressandjournal.co.uk/fp/news/aberdeen/854008/first-ever-display-of-guy-martins-machines-at-new-look-north-east-museum/|title=First-ever display of Guy Martin's machines at new-look museum|last=|first=|date=7 March 2016|work=The Press and Journal|access-date=|via=}}</ref>
== Views == {{editorial|section|date= June 2016}}
=== Work ethic === Martin attributes his strong work ethic to his father's example.<ref name=":275"/> He does not see his racing or TV presenting as real jobs, only hands-on activities.<ref name=":275"/> He has also retained his truck job in part due to the financial security it offered over racing.<ref name=":16"/> Describing it as "like an ingrained, default setting",<ref name=":2"/> he prioritises his mechanic job over other work, even cancelling complicated film shoots at short notice if needed.<ref name=":275"/> He takes more satisfaction in a well done truck job than from any motorbike race.<ref name=":3" /> He also seeks out casual work as a way to switch off during TT events (practice only being in the evenings).<ref name="telegraph.co.uk"/> Due to his passion for hard work and engineering, had he lived in [[Victorian era|Victorian]] times he sees himself as a railway [[Shop foreman|foreman]].<ref name=":16"/> He is not fond of spending too much time on the internet,<ref name="telegraph.co.uk"/> despairing at the distracting effect it has on today's apprentices, who lack interest and commitment.<ref name=":21"/> To work through aches and pains he takes [[cod liver oil]], but suspects it is only working as a [[Placebo|placebo effect]].<ref name=":275"/>
